intro: Oenothera resicum, commonly known as the desert evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant has hairy, linear leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or gravelly soils. Oenothera resicum is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
